qas.question: Who is eligible to participate?
qas.answer: Any student over the age of 18 enrolled in any college or university is allowed to participate. If you are younger than 18, but a Georgia Tech student, you can still participate.

qas.question: Who is eliglble to mentor/volunteer?
qas.answer: Anyone can mentor or volunteer. If you are interested in helping participants through their projects, then apply as a mentor. If you are interested in helping us run the event, then apply as a volunteer.

qas.question: Do I need any experience to apply?
qas.answer: No! Experience is not required. Hackathons are open environments for everyone. If you are new to hackathons, the Emerging Hacker track may be for you!

qas.question: How does the admissions process work?
Are there any costs?
qas.answer: No! HackGT # is completely free to participants and mentors thanks to our sponsors.

qas.question: Is there an admissions puzzle?
qas.answer: Perhaps... take a look around and you may find the way. ðŸ‘€

qas.question: Will hardware be provided?
qas.answer: We will provide hardware through our hardware desk!

qas.question: What do I need for the event
qas.answer: we recommend bringing a laptop, charger, headphones, water bottle, and anything else you'll need over the weekend. We'll provide hardware, meals, and snacks.

qas.question: Can I use past projects?
qas.answer: In general, no â€” true to the spirit of hackathons, you may not submit your past projects to HackGT.

qas.question: What if I don't have a team?
qas.answer: No worries! We will help you find your team based on your skills and interests through our team formation tool.

qas.question: Do projects need to be themed?
qas.answer: No, you can make anything you want! If you want more direction, we will also have sponsor challenges and HackGT 9 awards, which will be released before the event.

qas.question: What are the prizes?
qas.answer: We'll announce more info on prizes soon!
